label: Neurochemical-Neurological Substrate
description: The classical computational layer that transduces the quantum-filtered information from Layer 1 into the classical, electrochemical language of the nervous system. It governs the 'neurotransmitter economy' (DA, 5-HT, ACh, etc.), synaptic plasticity (LTP/LTD), and the metabolic 'slow control' network managed by glial cells. This layer provides the physical oscillators that are synchronized by the UPDE.

coreMechanisms.name: L1-L2 Quantum-to-Classical Bridge
coreMechanisms.description: The primary transduction interface. L1 quantum superposition (psi_L1) collapses to a definite probability (P_release) that gates neurotransmitter vesicle fusion. This is the 'Amplification of Intent' mechanism.

coreMechanisms.name: Synaptic Plasticity (LTP/LTD)
coreMechanisms.description: The classical mechanism for learning and memory. Describes the Hebbian and homeostatic processes of Long-Term Potentiation (LTP) and Long-Term Depression (LTD) that modify synaptic weights.

coreMechanisms.name: Neurotransmitter Economy
coreMechanisms.description: Defines the dynamic balance, synthesis, and reuptake of key neurotransmitter systems (Dopaminergic, Serotonergic, Cholinergic, etc.) that collectively define the brain's chemical state.

coreMechanisms.name: Glial-Metabolic Slow Control
coreMechanisms.description: The homeostatic network, primarily managed by astrocytes, that regulates the metabolic environment (e.g., lactate, glutamate) for the 'fast' neuronal computations, ensuring system stability.

interfacePoints.description: Receives quantum-filtered symbolic information that biases synaptic release probabilities (P_release).
Provides the physical, classical neural oscillators that are the substrate for the UPDE, which emerges at Layer 4.
The neurotransmitter economy (L2.M3) provides the direct biochemical substrate for the affective and psychoemotional states defined in Layer 5.

validation.description: Validates the L1->L2 quantum-to-classical bridge (L2.M1), simulating the collapse of psi_L1 to P_release.
Validates the emergence of UPDE dynamics (L4 interface). Simulates neural oscillators and confirms the critical coupling strength (K_crit) required for phase-locking.
Validates L2.M2 and L2.M3. Simulates the classical neurotransmitter economy and the rules of synaptic plasticity (LTP/LTD).
Validates L2.M4. Simulates the glial-metabolic slow-control network and its homeostatic management of the neural environment.
Integration and visualization suite. Confirms that all L2 modules can be integrated into a single, coherently functioning system.
